intro: Begonia ufoides, commonly known as the broadleaf begonia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It prefers shady, humid environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden beds. Its ornamental value comes from both its foliage and its delicate floral display.
